Description: Terracotta mould-made protome of a woman with hands in front of breasts with thumbs pointing up. Fragment of large figure: left arm, shoulder and breast. Left arm emerging from himation at elbow, wearing bracelet, holding breast. Subtle drapery of clothes is visible. Mould-made with an open flat back and base. Bracelet added after moulding. White coating preserved in patches. Pale red-brown fabric with buff surface, with rare fine silver mica inclusions.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Hellenion (Naukratis), Site 14 (Hogarth), under wall of second temple
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From the Hellenion precinct (14), under wall of 2nd temple, a 5th century BC deposit (Gutch in Hogarth et. al. 1899, 83, pl. 12. no. 67). Found with NA359 (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology). Two parallels from Naukratis of the same type and possibly from the same mould series (Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA385; NA389). East Greek protome bust (also known as a ‘shoulder-bust’) of a Classical Greek type (broadly 480BC-400BC). The fabric and style is similar to that of figurines of an East Greek origin. Parallels from Lindos, Rhodes, dated 525BC to 400BC (Blinkenberg 1931, 591, Type B2, pl.147-8) and in the British Museum from Rhodes, dated late 5th century BC (Higgins 1954, no. 295, GR1885, 1213.41). Similar pieces, not from the same mould, were found at Olynthus dated to the 5th century BC (Robinson 1952, pl.12, no.19; pl. 36, no.83; pl.38, nos 98 and 100). For context, function and details on protome parallels and fragments from Naukratis see protome records from Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA350, NA355, NA354, NA353, NA390, NA850, NA426, NA803 and NA509). Blinkenberg, C. 1931. Lindos. Fouilles de l’Acropole 1902-1914, I. Les petits objets, Berlin. Robinson, D. M. 1952. Olynthus XIV. Terracottas, lamps, and coins found in 1934 and 1938. Johns Hopkins University studies in archaeology. Baltimore, Johns Hopkins Press; London, Oxford University Press.
Bibliographic references: Gutch 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis, D. The Terracottas (p. 83, no. 67, pl. XII, no. 67)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.304) (Phase 3)
